intro: Pauridiantha paucinervis subsp. butaguensis, commonly known as the Butagué pauridiantha, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as cloud forests, where it thrives in high humidity and moderate temperatures. Its leaves are lanceolate, with a smooth surface and a distinct venation pattern that is characteristic of the species. The flowers are small and white, arranged in clustered umbels, contributing to its ornamental value in botanical gardens.
